channel.title: Easy way to transfer files through network?
channel.description:
I'm trying to send a file directly to my mom's computer. We are both on the same network (same router). I tried typing "ftp://192.168.0.5" (Her internal IP) into the address bar of IE (IE = FTP client), but it didn't work.
So how would I do this?

item.title: Easy way to transfer files through network?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Well, my router is already set-up (internet etc. works), but when I put a file into my shared folder, none of the other computers can see it.

Read full topic
item.source: Easy way to transfer files through network?

item.title: Easy way to transfer files through network?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I’m presuming your routers already set-up and therefore it should just work??

Read full topic

item.title: Easy way to transfer files through network?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:2, topic:4995”]if you have actually set up the network properly, make sure the drive/folder is shared

from then its easy[/quote]
Do I have to do anything to set up the network properly, besides putting the files in my shared folder (setup router etc.)?

Read full topic
item.source: Easy way to transfer files through network?

item.title: Easy way to transfer files through network?

item.description:
@Mmmk wrote:

Or drag and drop in shared documents…
